definition: to substitute/to act on behalf of others/to replace/generation/dynasty/age/period/(historical) era/(geological) eon
to substitute for/to take the place of/to replace/for/on behalf of/to stand in for

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this
to replace/to take over (a position or post)
player whose turn comes next (in a game)/next one/my humble home
to exchange/to replace/to substitute for/to switch
to renew or extend a contract
stand-in/substitute/body double/stuntman/scapegoat/fall guy/to stand in for sb else
spiritual leader (of a nation or church)/religious leader
